vulnerabilities.description_of_vuln: The application decodes JWT tokens without verifying the signature by setting 'verify_signature' to false

semantic_details.description: The application accepts JWT tokens without verifying their signature, allowing attackers to forge tokens with arbitrary user data
impact: Access to sensitive user information including the flag
scenario: Attacker obtains a legitimate JWT token
Attacker modifies the payload to include a different user_id (such as the flag user's ID)
Application accepts the modified token without signature verification
Attacker gains access to the flag user's account and data

vulnerabilities.description_of_vuln: The application uses a two-step authentication process that allows username enumeration

semantic_details.description: The login process is split into two steps, allowing attackers to determine if a username exists in the system
scenario: Attacker attempts to login with various usernames
The application confirms whether each username exists by redirecting to the password page
Attacker can build a list of valid usernames including special accounts
This information can be used for further attacks

vulnerabilities.description_of_vuln: Passwords are stored in plaintext in the database

semantic_details.description: User passwords are stored as plaintext in the database without any hashing or encryption
impact: Password exposure in case of database breach
scenario: Attacker gains access to all user passwords in plaintext
Attacker can use these credentials on other platforms (password reuse)
